column5: Went on our annual trip to northern Ontario in mid June. The fishing was very good for Walleye and Pike. The water level was much higher compared to previous years due to the longer winter we had. The bugs were quite bad when we went up but after a few days of not showering they seemed to leave us alone.  Most Walleyes were caught with a jig and plastic and the Pike were caught on long crankbaits/spinnerbaits and topwater.       View from our site   This is the average size we caught all week.        Until next year.  Gary
Some really beautiful pictures there Gary, thanks for the report
The first Walleye photo is awesome. Nice report.
great pics especially nice color on those eyes//   is black a good color for eyes? lake looks like glass  where abouts were u?
Awesome pics.      How many pickerel a day would you catch?
Wow...some incredible pictures!  Love that first walleye shot as well!  Congrats on a great trip....I'm heading up that way in a few weeks...hope to have an experience like you just had.
Wow, nice pictures... Question, what fly in service did you use??

I would approximate we caught a little over 200 Pike and Pickerel between 2 guys over the week. It was a new lake they opened up a couple years back and it held a lot of fish. We had access to 3 other lakes but the main lake was good enough. It was my first time up in this area of Ontario and we are hooked.
Actually the colour of the grub didnt really matter. I bought a tub of Gulp's and wanted to use them up on this trip. We were on a lake off the Wekyakastik River near Moosebunks neighbourhood.
Did you fly in with cochrane air services?
Very nice and sounds like an awesome trip. Thanks for the report along with the pics. Mike
